title: Can a void be created out of nothing? - Quora

response.answer_text: I would really believe to be agreeing that there actually, for the most part, is a possibility that the nothing, (absence of anything existing currently) stated in your definitely, for all intents and purposes, original query, for all intents and purposes, definitely for said question is already existing as a void, which is the absence of any object or material, and actually is thus synonymous with the definition of the statement “nothing” in a subtle, yet interconnected, way, or so I for the most part think. TL;DR, nothing is already a void, man.

Can a void be created out of nothing? Well a ‘void’ is nothing right? So you seem to be asking if an empty space can be created out of nothing. Well aren’t ‘nothing’ and ‘void’ just two different words for the same thing? It’s a bit like asking if I could make a non-existent sandwich out of no food. Well, sure of course I could.
No. A void is impossible. There is no such thing as nothing. A place of no thing would be immediately filled with something.
